video.title: Azure Data Fundamentals Certification (DP-900) - Full Course to PASS the Exam
video.description:
Prepare for the Azure Data Fundamentals Certification and pass!

✏️ Course developed by Andrew Brown of ExamPro. Check out the ExamPro YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/ExamProChannel
🔗 ExamPro Cloud Obsessed Certification Training: https://www.exampro.co

☁️ Data Concepts
🎤 (0:10:12) Auzre Core Data Related Services
🎤 (0:14:55) Types of Cloud Computing
🎤 (0:16:56) Azure Data Related Roles
🎤 (0:18:42) Database Administrator Common tools
🎤 (0:20:27) Data Engineering Common tools
🎤 (0:21:43) Data Analyst Common tools
🎤 (0:22:26) Data Overview
🎤 (0:23:43) Introduction to Data
🎤 (0:24:32) Data documents
🎤 (0:25:30) Data sets
🎤 (0:28:31) Data types
🎤 (0:32:15) Schema vs Schemaless
🎤 (0:34:09) Query and Querying
🎤 (0:35:54) Batch vs Stream processing
🎤 (0:38:30) Relational data
🎤 (0:40:35) Relational data Relationships
🎤 (0:42:07) Row store vs Column store
🎤 (0:43:44) Database Index
🎤 (0:45:05) Data Integegrity vs Data Corruption
🎤 (0:47:11) Normalized vs Denomralized data
🎤 (0:48:32) Pivot table
🎤 (0:50:10) Strongly consistent vs Eventually consistent
🎤 (0:51:33) Synchronus vs Asynchronous
🎤 (0:53:29) Non relational data
🎤 (0:54:29) Data source
🎤 (0:55:41) Data store
🎤 (0:56:32) Database
🎤 (0:57:56) Data warehouse
🎤 (0:59:39) Data mart
🎤 (1:00:36) Data lakes
🎤 (1:01:42) Data lakehouse
🎤 (1:03:12) Data structures
🎤 (1:04:02) Unstructured data
🎤 (1:04:47) Semi structured
🎤 (1:06:10) Semi structured Data Structures
🎤 (1:07:16) Semi structure JSON
🎤 (1:08:11) semi structure ORC
🎤 (1:09:39) semi structure Parquets
🎤 (1:10:35) semi structure AVRO
🎤 (1:11:25) Structured Data
🎤 (1:11:56) Data mining
🎤 (1:13:02) Data mining methods
🎤 (1:14:28) Data wrangling
🎤 (1:15:31) Ddata modeling
🎤 (1:17:18) ETL vs ELT
🎤 (1:19:18) Data analytics
🎤 (1:20:14) Key performance indicators KPI
🎤 (1:21:23) Data Analytic Techniques
🎤 (1:23:02) Microsoft One Drive
🎤 (1:24:20) Microsoft Sharepoint
🎤 (1:25:49) Data Core Concepts CheatSheet

☁️ Azure Synapse and Data Lake
🎤 (1:33:36) Azure Synapse Analytics
🎤 (1:35:26) Sypanse SQL and pools
🎤 (1:37:19) Synapse Key Features
🎤 (1:38:31) Azure Data Lake Gen 2
🎤 (1:40:03) Polybase
🎤 (1:40:50) Synapse ELT
🎤 (1:41:51) Azure Data Lake Analytics
🎤 (1:43:05) Azure Sypanse and Data Lakes CheatSheet

☁️ Account Storage
🎤 (1:44:25) Azure Blob Storage
🎤 (1:45:20) Azure Files
🎤 (1:47:14) Azure Storage Accounts CheatSheet

☁️ Power BI
🎤 (1:48:07) Business Intelligence
🎤 (1:48:40) Power BI
🎤 (1:51:29) Power BI Visualizations
🎤 (1:53:13) Power BI Embedded
🎤 (1:54:02) Power BI Interactive Reports
🎤 (1:55:36) Power BI Service and Dashboards
🎤 (1:56:47) Reports vs Dashboards
🎤 (1:57:47) Paginated Reports
🎤 (1:58:57) Power BI CheatSheet

☁️ Relational Databases
🎤 (2:00:38) Structured Query Language
🎤 (2:01:48) OLAP vs OLAP
🎤 (2:03:14) Open Source Relational Databases
🎤 (2:06:01) Read Replicas
🎤 (2:07:10) Citus Postgres Hyperscale
🎤 (2:08:03) Azure SQL Family
🎤 (2:10:30) Elastic pools
🎤 (2:11:45) Relational Databases CheatSheet

☁️ T SQL
🎤 (2:14:12) T SQL
🎤 (2:15:40) Data Defintion Language
🎤 (2:16:43) Data Manipulation Language
🎤 (2:18:02) Data Query Language
🎤 (2:19:08) Data Control Language
🎤 (2:19:36) Transaction Control Langauge
🎤 (2:20:22) SQL Document Comparsions
🎤 (2:21:10) T SQL CheatSheet

☁️ Database Security
🎤 (2:22:01) Connectivity Architecture
🎤 (2:23:13) Database Authentication
🎤 (2:24:41) Network Connectivity
🎤 (2:25:19) Azure Defender for SQL
🎤 (2:25:54) Azure Database Server Firewalls
🎤 (2:27:00) Always Encrypted
🎤 (2:27:47) Role Based Access Controls
🎤 (2:28:48) Transparent Data Encryption
🎤 (2:29:49) Dynamic Data Masking
🎤 (2:31:02) Private Links
🎤 (2:31:57) Database Security Cheatsheet

☁️ Azure Tables Cosmos DB
🎤 (2:34:13) Key Value Store
🎤 (2:35:40) Document Store
🎤 (2:36:33) Mongo DB
🎤 (2:38:35) Graph Database
🎤 (2:39:42) Apache Tinkerpop and Gremlin
🎤 (2:41:23) Azure Tables
🎤 (2:42:45) Azure Cosmos DB
🎤 (2:44:40) Azure Table Account Storage vs Cosmos DB
🎤 (2:46:39) Azure Tables and CosmosDB CheatSheet

☁️ Hadoop Systems
🎤 (2:48:29) Apache Hadoop
🎤 (2:49:57) Apache Kafka
🎤 (2:50:53) HDInsights
🎤 (2:52:05) Hadoop CheatSheet

☁️ Azure and Databricks
🎤 (2:53:21) Apache Spark
🎤 (2:55:04) Azure Databricks
🎤 (2:57:16) Apache Spark and Databricks CheatSheet

☁️ ELT and SQL Tools
🎤 (2:58:46) SQL Server Management Studio
🎤 (2:59:37) SQL Server Data Tools
🎤 (3:00:58) Azure Data Studio
🎤 (3:01:48) Azure Data Factory
🎤 (3:02:59) SQL Server Integration Services
🎤 (3:04:08) ETL and SQL Tools CheatSheet

☁️ Follow Alongs
🎤 (3:05:38) Install and Use Power BI
🎤 (3:08:17) Launch Azure SQL and Use Data Studio
🎤 (3:34:53) Use Azure SQL as data source in Power BI
🎤 (3:44:20) Use SSMS to perform a query on Azure SQL
🎤 (3:47:37) Create Blob and File storage
🎤 (3:57:36) Explore CosmosDB various NoSQL engines
🎤 (4:27:08) Create a ELT job from Azure SQL to Blob Storage
🎤 (4:33:06) Explore Azure Databricks
🎤 (4:39:49) Explore Azure Synapse Analytics
🎤 (4:44:47) Cleanup

topLevelComment.author: DarkMatter

topLevelComment.author: Chris Hinson
topLevelComment.text: Passed the exam today! Thank you for the video it was a big help especially the cheat sheets. Worked through the Microsoft learning paths and this video and that was enough for me to take the test.

replies.author: Chris Hinson
replies.text: @Gold-hunter Hi, I studied for about 10 hours total, including time spent watching this video and working through the microsoft learning modules on this topic. I do have some experience in this field as I work in this field as part of my job. If you join on of the microsoft learning events at the end you can get a voucher that make taking this exam free. If its free no reason not to do it right? Good Luck!

replies.author: Gold-hunter
replies.text: Hey, can you please tell me how long did you study for the exam and how much experience you had prevously on the data field ? I want to take the exam but I am not sure

topLevelComment.author: Rodi
topLevelComment.text: this video is for refreshing ..dont start here. It is a horrible course...great free material for brushing up ..thanks a lot but a very horrible , unclear rushed course for beginers

replies.author: Rodi
replies.text:
@Ángel Maravilla Microsoft has this virtual training for these ...they are free but they are also in YouTube..check this out  https://youtu.be/YJnchDGDvUk 
Then check out John Savills dp 900 cram ...ms learn is the syllabus and of you can learn from that it is the best but it is mostly in text form which does not suit for me ..i love interactive so if you are fine with documentation type go for it if not try the above videos ....do practice tests .... whatever course or video you see are only 50% because practice tests expose us to many actual stuff ...there are also many free practice tests out there

topLevelComment.author: Adam Chandley

I should've been looking into resources like this for a long time, nice refresher.

topLevelComment.author: Stephen E.G.C Buckle

topLevelComment.author: Stephen E.G.C Buckle
topLevelComment.text: Maybe that envelope encryption key service, EKS, as you abbreviated, has something to do with Azure Key Vault?

topLevelComment.author: Stephen E.G.C Buckle
topLevelComment.text: the subfix AB signifies Swedish corporate company like for example, the LTD at the end of Wallmart i.e Wallmart LTD. So MySQL AB is not a Swiss proprietor it is Swedish. BTW, thanks for this course, it was more than useful.

replies.text: @Kangroo this video covers most of the DP-900 exam part and also give you idea about every service but I felt that this video should have also covered much more on non relational data where in this video it’s not covered in very detailed manner, but coming to practical experience it depends upon the individual, everyone won’t get chance to play with things in Azure except for the people who deal with Azure services within an organisation or the people who purchase it individually.I suggest for non relational data section go with Microsoft docs, except this section other sections are covered very well.

replies.author: Kangroo
replies.text: Was this video enough to learn all the materials keeping the practice aside?

topLevelComment.author: Ahmed Mohiuddin
topLevelComment.text: Thank you so much for your great works. You did a fantastic job. You covered almost everything in a nutshell for the Azure world. You are helping us way way more than we are helping you. Thanks again

topLevelComment.author: Mellie M
topLevelComment.text: ess-kyu-ell..seekwull, man, seekwull.

topLevelComment.author: JustSpiderbro
topLevelComment.text:
Thank you, passed the DP-900 exam first time with a score of 857 thanks to your video!

I personally thought this exam was much more difficult than the AZ-900. Even though I attended an MS virtual training event and read through all of the relevant learning paths, I still had no idea how to answer a few of the questions and must have had a few lucky guesses.

replies.author: Mr. Berry
replies.text: @Arjun Esnapur AZ-900 is for beginners, tech sales people, and executives for companies that use Azure.

replies.author: JustSpiderbro
replies.text: @Arjun Esnapur it is helpful but not mandatory.

replies.author: Shrish Kumar Srivastava

replies.author: Josie Davis
replies.text: @Rao Aaditya thanks

replies.author: Rao Aaditya
replies.text: @Josie Davis no I didn’t, paper was straight forward pretty easy to moderate i would say. Just don’t waste your time without studying properly like me. You’ll crack it in first try.

replies.author: Josie Davis
replies.text: @Rao Aaditya thanks for the info! I’m sure you’ll smash next time 😊 did you use any practice exams?

replies.author: Rao Aaditya
replies.text: @Josie Davis yes, you can submit whenever you want but you’ll have to appear on the given time. Or reschedule the exam 24 hours prior the exam. PS I just missed by 25 marks. I got 675 and passing marks are 700. I didn’t study hard enough so that’s okay.

topLevelComment.author: TheGeekSurgeon
topLevelComment.text: Andrew Thank you for the resource you have provided I passed 9_21_21. This is my first step to becoming a data scientist. Thank you.

topLevelComment.author: Carb Gaming
topLevelComment.text: For anyone taking this test, I would encourage that you study Azure Data API's very well. I took the test today and was not prepared for the number of questions regarding that topic. Still passed, but wish I would have been a bit more prepared.

replies.author: Romario Lawrence
replies.text: @DenCato oh man thats crazy but I guess worth it if its in the comfort of your own home.

replies.author: DenCato
replies.text:
​@Romario Lawrence You have to have a clean desk and room (which you have to show with your camera before the exam), and camera and speaker is on all the time! 

The exam runs in a fullscreen program that you cannot leave or tab out and they watch and listen while you do the exam. 

I heard that if they hear anyone speak you get failed, so you have to make sure it is a private room where you are not disturbed.

replies.author: Romario Lawrence
replies.text: @DenCato okay so how are you monitored throughout this?

replies.author: DenCato
replies.text: @Romario Lawrence I did it online with Pearson VUE

replies.author: Romario Lawrence
replies.text: @DenCato where did you do the exam online or through an institution?

topLevelComment.author: SEO experimentations
topLevelComment.text:
43:35 typo should be OLAP not OLTP, Columnar Databases are great because you're always aggregating on a particular column
i.e GROUP BY col_name...

topLevelComment.author: AkuL M S
topLevelComment.text:
Incorrect Information in Azure Connectivity Architecture presentation: @ 02:22:04
Where you showed the port for SQL is 1443 which is wrong. 
The Correct port is 1433.

replies.author: Luke Cragg
replies.text: Thanks for confirming. I was really confused when the internet mentions 1433 everywhere and my external connectivity to my Azure SQL DB was working on 1433 not 1443.

topLevelComment.text: THE PORT FOR SQL IS 1433, NOT 1443. JUST FYI. Hope that helps someone.
